title: Airline mulls service cuts over 'flight-shaming' fears
text:
Europe’s biggest regional airline could axe routes as a result of the so-called flight-shaming movement, its boss has claimed.

Virgin Connect, the new name for Flybe, is already preparing to cut jobs and services in a bid to learn from what chief executive Mark Anderson said were “mistakes in the past”.

Flybe nearly collapsed earlier this year after being just hours from running out of cash. It was bought by an investor group led by Virgin Atlantic, the airline set up by Sir Richard Branson, and Mr Anderson was brought in to turn the company around.

Speaking at an aviation conference in Westminster on Thursday, Mr Anderson said: “Maybe there are some routes in the future, as I look at the future...
description: Europe’s biggest regional airline could axe routes as a result of the so-called flight-shaming movement, its boss has claimed.
